FuncDef:
The erps ring command creates an ERPS ring and displays the view of the ERPS ring, or displays the view of a specific ERPS ring.
The undo erps ring command deletes the created ERPS ring. The erps ring command creates an ERPS ring and displays the view of the ERPS ring, or displays the view of a specific ERPS ring. The undo erps ring command deletes the created ERPS ring. By default, no ERPS ring is created on the device. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K and CE6820S.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of an ERPS ring.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

ExtraInfo: Ethernet Ring Protection Switching (ERPS) is a standard protocol issued by the ITU-T to prevent loops on ring networks. ERPS provides carrier-class reliability with a fast convergence speed. ERPS takes effect on a ring network if all devices on a ring network support it.
